alert.note: Alert for Central and East Adams and Arapahoe Counties; Elbert, Central and East Douglas Counties Above 6000 Feet; North Douglas County Below 6000 Feet, Denver, West Adams and Arapahoe Counties, East Broomfield County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 29 at 3:50PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...Landspouts will be possible across northeastern Douglas, northwestern Elbert and central Arapahoe Counties through 415 PM MDT... At 348 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking developing thunderstorms capable of producing a landspout tornado along a line extending from 3 miles southwest of Bennett to near The Pinery, or along a line extending from 50 miles northwest of Limon to 22 miles southeast of Denver. Movement was northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Landspouts possible. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Landspout tornadoes can damage mobile homes, roofs, vehicles, and trees. Outdoor objects may be tossed about. Locations impacted include... Southern Aurora, southeastern Centennial, Parker, The Pinery and Ponderosa Park. LANDSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. If a tornado is spotted seek shelter inside a sturdy building.
